original: Ivarsson, Martin Sigfrid Einar, läroverksadjunkt, Jönköping, f. 6/4/00 i Hiäldstad, Älvsb. 1. G. 41 m. Eyvoir Dawidson. Barn : Kaj f. 42, Barbro 45. — Stud:ex. i Skara 20, fil. kand. i Upps. 24, fil. mag. 26, provår v. Gbgs h. real 34-35. Res. t. Danm. 31 o. 32, Tyskl. 34 o. 38. E. lär. i Borås 28-29, vik. adj. i Karlskrona 29, e. lär. i Kristinehamn 30-32, i Sala 32-34, v. Gbgs h. real 35-37, adj. i modersm. o. tyska v. Jönköp. h. a. 1. sed. 37. Skr.: Folkligt 1700-tal (38), upps. i språkl. m. fl. ämnen i bl. a. Nysv. Stud. samt Namn o. Bygd, art. o. rec. i pressen.
translated: Ivarsson, Martin Sigfrid Einar, high school teacher, Jönköping, b. April 6, 1900 in Hiäldstad, Älvsborgs County. Married in 1941 to Eyvoir Dawidson. Children: Kaj b. 1942, Barbro b. 1945. Obtained his high school diploma in Skara in 1920, Bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1924, Master’s degree in 1926, teaching internship at Gothenburg’s high school for boys in 1934-35. Traveled to Denmark in 1931 and 1932, Germany in 1934 and 1938. Was a substitute teacher in Borås in 1928-29, substitute teacher in Karlskrona in 1929, regular teacher in Kristinehamn in 1930-32, in Sala in 1932-34, at Gothenburg’s high school for boys in 1935-37, and has been a regular German and Swedish language teacher at Jönköping’s high school for boys since 1937. Writer of "Folkligt 1700-tal" (1938) and articles and reviews on language and various subjects in publications such as Nysvensk Studier and Namn och Bygd, and in the press.
